intro: Vicia narbonensis subsp. serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated vetch, is a perennial legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces slender, cylindrical pods that contain several elliptical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats. This subspecies is valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability and historical use in traditional agriculture.
